Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Designer] Broken MSBuild logic" (#1501) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The following two commits:
 - https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/e55d6557f6a273a21be3cf72893f12a86f1ec359
 - https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/e824170632e0b9115ee65d9dc07c41fa3b8907b6

Broke the designer target `GetExtraLibraryLocationsForDesigner` because the first redefines the path of the cache file `_AndroidResourcePathsCache` and the second prevents that path from ever being created.

Opened issue "[Android] API 22 - MaximumDate not clickable for DatePicker" (#2316) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Given 
```C#
var datePicker = new DatePicker { AutomationId = "datePicker" };
			datePicker.MinimumDate = new DateTime (2015, 1, 1);
			datePicker.MaximumDate = new DateTime (2015, 6, 1);
			datePicker.Date = DateTime.Now;
```

- The Datepicker will show as having 2015/6/1 as selected
- open the calendar and click a different date
- open the calendar and try to reselect 2015/6/1

This works fine on API 23 but on API 22 it does not

### Steps to Reproduce
Using an API 22 device

- Run Issue2987 in the Android Control Gallery
- The Datepicker will show as having 2015/6/1 as selected
- open the calendar and click a different date
- open the calendar and try to reselect 2015/6/1

### Expected Behavior
I should be able to click on  2015/6/1

### Actual Behavior
I can't click on  2015/6/1

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.1 SR1

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Android] Changing from Portrait to Landspace while the calendar is open causes MinimumDate and MaximumDate to be visually ignored" (#2315) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
```C#
var datePicker = new DatePicker { AutomationId = "datePicker" };
datePicker.MinimumDate = new DateTime (2015, 1, 1);
datePicker.MaximumDate = new DateTime (2015, 5, 31);
```

- Click the TextBox to open the calendar
- Rotate the phone to go from Portrait to Landspace

Now you'll be able to scroll the calendar outside the date ranges of Min/Max
You're not able to actually select anything outside those ranges but it now looks like you can

### Steps to Reproduce
- Run Issue2987 in the Android Control Gallery
- click the box to open the calendar
- Rotate the phone

### Expected Behavior

When going from Portrait to Landscape the visibly selectable dates shouldn't change

### Actual Behavior
When going from Portrait to Landscape you can now scroll outside the Max/Min range

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.1 SR1
- Last known good version: Not sure

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[iOS] ListView does not scroll when a control in listview has a PanGestureRecognizer" (#2299) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
When a listview has a control that contains a PanGestureRecognizer it will not scroll when you try to scroll and you touch the contol with the PanGestureRecognizer. When you touch outside the contol with PanGestureRecognizer it will scroll fine. It seems that the PanGestureRecognizer blocks the gesture event from bubbeling up to the listview so it won't scroll any more. This is only an issue on iOS, on Android it does work fine.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Put two labels in a listview viewcell. 
2. Give one label a PanGestureRecognizer.
3. Bind to a list with enough items so that not all items are visible in the listview.
4. Start the iOS simulator.
5. Touch a label without PanGestureRecognizer and try to scroll. It will work fine.
6 Touch a label with PanGestureRecognizer and try to scroll. It will not scroll.

### Expected Behavior
I would expect that when I touch a control in a listview with a PanGestureRecognizer I would still be able to scroll the listview in iOS. Or at least it should work the same on both platforms. In that case we should have control if gesture event must bubble up to listview or not.

### Actual Behavior
When a listview has a control that contains a PanGestureRecognizer it will not scroll when you try to scroll and you touch the contol with the PanGestureRecognizer. 

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: all latest versions
- Last known good version: not known
- IDE: Visual Studio for windows 15.6.5

- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  11.9.1.24
  - Android: 8.2.0.16
- Android Support Library Version: 27.0.2
- Nuget Packages: XF 2.5.1.444934
- Affected Devices: All iOS devices

See the attached zip with a very simple example solution that demonstrates the issue.
[GestureIssue.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1881799/GestureIssue.zip)

Opened issue "[iOS / Android] Cannot focus a custom component" (#2295) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description

When using a custom component, it is not possible to handle the Focused event

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new cross-platform project (.NET Standard)
2. Create a new custom component with the focused event handled
3. Include it on the MainPage.xaml
3. On the MainPage.xaml.cs, call MyCustomComponent.Focus()

### Expected Behavior
The Focused event is fired

### Actual Behavior
Nothing happens

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 
Xamarin.Forms 2.3.4.270 => KO
Xamarin.Forms 2.4.0.91020 => KO
Xamarin.Forms 2.5.0.280555 => KO
Xamarin.Forms 2.5.1.44934 => KO

- Last known good version: Unknowm
- IDE: Visual Studio 15.6.5
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS: 11.9.1.21
  - Android: 8.2.0.16
  - UWP:  Not included in the scope
- Android Support Library Version: 25.4.0.2
- Nuget Packages: Only those included in the initial project startup
- Affected Devices: iOS, Android at least

### Reproduction Link

[App2.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1881321/App2.zip)
